text: I passed a patch to fix the general issue of having 4 different lists so I don't think that your patch is necessary.
Honestly, these values are not even checked. We could replace the whole thing by range(40). Is it worth spending time on this issue?

For reference Alex's fix was here: https://github.com/nilearn/nilearn/commit/da17372b4f4947615bcf34d7e20c3335dd3326b0

Actually I think the problem is that the asarray doesn't have an explicit dtype. @AlexandreAbraham can you add it ?
Oh and I forgot using 'i8' for the dtype is better than 'int' since it is more explicit. 'int' depends on the platform.
Good enough for now, thanks. Closing.
